fact_check_explanation_title: How much do Lib Dem MPs claim in expenses?
fact_check_explanation_summary: A Facebook post gets the expenses claims of Lib Dem MPs roughly right, but their collective claims are around average for all MPs overall.

fact_check_explanation_title: This picture shows a model of an extinct amphibian
fact_check_explanation_summary: A picture showing a ‘hammerhead salamander’ shows a model of a diplocaulus, an extinct amphibian.

fact_check_explanation_title: No evidence for how Supreme Court judges voted in EU referendum
fact_check_explanation_summary: Judges have to stay politically impartial, and we have no idea how they voted.

fact_check_explanation_title: This video of a crowd booing Boris Johnson is not from the 2019 Conservative party conference
Pretty Little Thing products can contain lead, but probably not dangerous amounts
fact_check_explanation_summary: The State of California requires companies to declare if they use any chemicals from a toxicity list.

fact_check_explanation_title: This is a real photo of Margaret Thatcher and Menachem Begin
fact_check_explanation_summary: It was taken in 1979 during his visit to the UK as Israel’s prime minister.

fact_check_explanation_title: Top CEOs make average worker salary in three days
fact_check_explanation_summary: In 2018 the average pay for a FTSE 100 CEO was £3.5 million – over 110 times the average full-time salary.

fact_check_explanation_title: Poverty in the UK: a guide to the facts and figures
fact_check_explanation_summary: How many people are in poverty in the UK, and how has this been changing in recent years?

fact_check_explanation_title: Claim about cost of Labour’s welfare policy is unsubstantiated
fact_check_explanation_summary: This estimate for Labour’s welfare bill is meaningless because Labour haven’t detailed their welfare policies.

fact_check_explanation_title: Labour didn’t vote to scrap all immigration controls
fact_check_explanation_summary: Labour passed a motion at its party conference to extend free movement. This doesn’t mean scrapping all immigration controls.

fact_check_explanation_title: Is Luxembourg the biggest beneficiary of the EU?
fact_check_explanation_summary: A Facebook post falsely claims that Luxembourg receives the most EU spending, relative to what it pays in.

fact_check_explanation_title: It’s not certain that 87 people a day are dying waiting for care
fact_check_explanation_summary: The data behind this figure has limitations and there are some reasons to suspect the true figure may be lower.
